name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hilltop Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean but smallish room. Beds comfortable. Updated bathroom area. Friendly and accomodating front desk staff. Best complimetary breakfast I have had in a hotel in California. Full hot breakfast buffet served in a restaurant that was part of the hotel building. Impressive
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient, good room with attached restaurant. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the way to update an older motel. Just goes to show you can't necessarily judge a hotel by its age. Everything in the room of importance had been updated. The rooms were not overly large but you probably won't notice since they've done such a nice job remodeling. The adjacent restaurant at the hotel offered good food, good service, and you can't beat the convenience of the location.
reviews.title: Nicely updated

reviews.text: We got a room facing the pool - which was great. The children's pool worked out great with our pre-schoolers.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great kiddie pool - unfortunately, carpeting is disgusting.

reviews.text: Full breakfast wasn't really great. I didn't even eat. Their 'restaurant' on site is a choice of seating in the bar or in an open area right off the lobby with television overhead. Certainly not ideal.
reviews.title: Fine for business

reviews.text: I recently stayed in room 110. It's a handicap access room, so it was very roomy. My only complaint is the lack of WIFI signal in the rooms. If you step right outside the door of the room - bang - strong signal. Close the door and it's lost immediately. I spoke with several front desk personnel and they all stated that the system had recently been upgraded. Looks like they didn't bother testing the signal strength in the rooms, though.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - bad WIFI in rooms

reviews.text: They do have a computer in the lobby for public use; it's speed isn't the greatest, but it'll do.
reviews.title: Very clean and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An observation....the refrigerator is located right next to the toilet. That also happens to be where the coffee maker is. Kinda gross, actually. Do you really want to make a cup of coffee next to what is basically a public toilet?
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay despit our concerns re proximit to I5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the rooms don't have full sized ironing boards. They have little travel size boards, which are basically useless for ironing pants. You can get a loaner full-sized board from the front desk.
reviews.title: the Best Best Western I've stayed at ever

likes.liked: — great on-site restaurant and heated pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not have very high expectations, but the hotel was very clean(looked to have been remodeled) and friendly staff. Furniture in good shape and good location.
reviews.title: Pretty good, but a little disappointed

likes.disliked: — Being made to pay extra for a room change

reviews.text: If you decide to stay at this hotel, do not take Room 135 WIFI signal very poor - actually it did not work at all. We were at a tournament that weekend of the 13th of March and our daughter has to finish her homeworks and she had to go to the front desk computer and could not finish because she could not stay too long at the computer because of other guests trying to use it.. Front desk was told but she said no one was complaining about it and that as far as she knew it was working well. Beds not too comfortable -- and pillows were the worse. First and last time I stay at this place.
reviews.title: Best Western Hilltop in Redding, Ca

reviews.text: Really loved this place to stay in Redding, California. Go figure, but I believe that Redding California has cornered the market on double beds. We went to a number of hotels and they almost exclusively had double beds which does not work for our family with two teenage boys. This hotel had the queen beds that we were looking for thank goodness or else no family harmony! The food for breakfast has been the best part of the stay ... simply awesome! This was definitely worth the stay.
reviews.title: Will return again sometime

reviews.text: Just returned from my weekend trip staying at this place for two nights. Housekeeping (beds, coffeemaker etc) is good. Free breakfast at restaurant is really good. Locations is good - lots of restaurants nearby; short driving distances to many of the area attractions. Room is a bit small but not crampy. Free DVDs at front desk. My biggest gripe is the carpets in my room were so dirty - probably not cleaned in years!!! When I mentioned that to the front desk - she told me two things: (1) that was first time she is hearing that complaint and (2) they clean carpets every week. May be other people didnt complain but it is a blatant lie that they clean the carpet every week. Your feet would become black in a couple of minutes and you will carry that on to your beds. If you can live with the yucky carpet- pretty decent place, but I am not going back.
reviews.title: good place but super dirty carpet

reviews.text: Basically a standard old-fashioned strip motel, but well maintained and serviced. It was comfortable and convenient, and we had no complaints. It has a good restaurant, and breakfast is included.
reviews.title: Fairly good motel; good restaurant.

reviews.text: After a long drive from Disneyland this was just the place we needed to cool off in the pool and have a good nights sleep. From the front desk, the room, the pool to the breakfast all were excellent. Yes I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: WOW. I'm kind of pickey about the Best Western chain - some are great, some not so great - but this one is GREAT! This is the third year I've stayed there, so the service is reliable over time...
reviews.title: The Best Best Western I've Stayed At... (And I've been to a lot!)

likes.disliked: — No view - and it's a chain hotel/motel, lots of identical doors... Just not asthetically pleasing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's less than 2 miles from the convention center, but that's not what makes it great... What makes it great is all of the FREE STUFF!!!
reviews.title: Good quality Best Western

reviews.text: It's attached to a great restauraunt - CR Gibbs. Not just nearby - it's literally attached! You can head down for meals, order by phoning the extension & picking up - or ROOM SERVICE!
reviews.title: small room!

reviews.text: But back to the FREE STUFF! =)
reviews.title: Very impressed!

reviews.text: They also use the restauraunt for free hot buffet breakfast in the mornings - eggs, bacon, sasuage, potatoes, ceraels, juice, yogurt & more. And it's good, not stale/cold/stickey...
reviews.title: A breath of fresh air

likes.liked: — The great food at the breakfast buffet was probably the icing on the cake!
likes.disliked: — Nothing at all, it was perfect.

description: This unique AAA three-diamond hotel is located within the heart of one of the country's most beautiful regions - the Shasta Cascade. Our 114 upscale guestrooms have been tastefully decorated, offering either King, 2 Queens,or King with Sofabed. Hotel amenities: Free full hot breakfast buffet, complimentary high-speed wireless internet access, free business center, free local & toll free phone access,fitness center, complimentary DVD rentals, free USA Today newspaper Mon-Fri, outdoor heated pool & spa, in-room refrigerator, guest laundry, ample parking and conference room banquet facilities hold up to 100 persons. Relax and enjoy our on-site award winning restaurant C.R. Gibbs American Grille - lunch 11:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., 'Nutzy Hour' 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., dinner 4:00 p.m. to closing. Enjoy dining on our outside patio. Only blocks away from high end shopping, specialty shops and two miles from California's newest destination icon the Sundial Bridge at Turtle Bay Museum and Arboretum.
